column1: '''The Ettenmoors''' were a mountainous, wild, and untamed land that lay north of [[Rivendell]].

column2: Flight}}</ref> the region was likely infested with [[Trolls]].

column1: The Ettenmoors included the land of the [[Ettendales]], which consisted of valleys reaching into the foothills of the [[Misty Mountains]].<ref>{{HM
It is speculated that [[Mount Gram]], from where a host of [[Orcs]] [[Battle of Greenfields
column2: attacked]] [[the Shire]], was located in the Ettenmoors.<ref>{{HM
1975}} the [[Witch-king]] of [[Angmar]] fled after his defeat in the [[Battle of Fornost]].<ref>{{App
column4: Chieftain]] [[Arador]] was slain by trolls in this area<ref>{{App

column2: 3018}}, scouts from [[Rivendell]] investigated the Ettenmoors for any activities concerning the servants of [[Sauron]], but they came with no warning news.<ref>{{FR

column1: The name ''Ettenmoors'' consists of ''etten'' (derived from [[Old English]] ''eōten'' "[[Giants
column2: giant]], troll") and ''moor'' ("high barren land").<ref name=RC/>

column1: The name ''Ettenmoors'' is similar to the land of [http://narnia.wikia.com/wiki/Ettinsmoor Ettinsmoor] of [[The Chronicles of Narnia
Fells translates to hills or moorland, thus "troll-fells" were hills in which [[trolls]] lived.<ref name=RC>{{HM

The first instance of ''troll-fells'' was devoid of a dash and was capitalized, "Trollfells": [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote on a map: "Alter Entish Lands to [Trollfells > Bergrisland >] Ettenmoor". This is also the first mention of Ettenmoor(s) in the legendarium.<ref name="Map">{{TI

column3: Map of the Ettenmoors from ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]

column1: :The Ettenmoors is the region where player vs player play takes place. The land has three keeps (Lugazag, Tirith Rhaw and Tol Ascarnen), Isendeep Mine and Grimwood Lumber Camp that can be controlled by either the forces of Angmar or the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.
